

INTERNSHIP AGREEMENT



This Internship Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into on this 21st  day of February, 2025, 

by and between Learnrithm LTD (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and Nwobu Lydia Nikechukwu

(hereinafter referred to as the "Intern"). The parties hereby agree as follows:



1. POSITION AND DUTIES

   1.1 The Intern is hereby engaged as a Content Creator for the Company.

   1.2 The Intern shall produce no fewer than Four (4) content pieces per calendar month, which equates to an average of One (1) content pieces per week, during the term of this Agreement.

   1.3 The Intern agrees to perform the services in a professional manner, exercising due diligence, skill, and care as reasonably required in the industry.



2. TERM OF THE AGREEMENT

   2.1 This Agreement shall commence on February 21st , 2025, and shall remain in full force and effect for a period of three (3) months, terminating on May 21st , 2025, unless sooner terminated pursuant  to Section 6 of this Agreement.



3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

   3.2 Upon satisfactory completion of the internship, the Intern shall be entitled to receive the following benefits at no additional cost:

       (a) One (1) year of full, complimentary access to the Pro feature of Learnrithm AI;

       (b) An official Internship Certificate duly signed by the Company; and

       (c) A Recommendation Letter from the undersigned representative of the Company.



4. OWNERSHIP OF WORK PRODUCT

   4.1 All content, materials, and related intellectual property created or developed by the Intern  in connection with her duties hereunder shall be deemed a "work made for hire" and shall be  the sole and exclusive property of the Company.

   4.2 The Intern hereby irrevocably assigns and transfers to the Company all rights, title, and  interest in and to such work product, including any copyrights or other proprietary rights therein.

   4.3 The Intern waives any and all claims to any moral rights or other rights of attribution in  connection with the work product.



5. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

   5.1 The Intern shall maintain in strict confidence any and all proprietary or confidential information disclosed to her by the Company or otherwise learned during the course of the internship.

   5.2 The Intern shall not, during or subsequent to the term of this Agreement, disclose any such confidential information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

   5.3 Any inventions, improvements, or discoveries made by the Intern during the course of the internship that relate to the Company’s business shall be promptly disclosed and shall become the exclusive property of the Company.



6. TERMINATION

   6.1 This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either party upon providing one (1) day written notice to the other party.

   6.2 In the event of termination, the Intern shall be compensated only for the work performed up to the effective date of termination.

   6.3 Termination of this Agreement shall not relieve the Intern of her obligations under Sections 4 and 5 of this Agreement.



7. INDEMNIFICATION

   7.1 The Intern agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Company, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, or expenses  arising out of or related to any breach of this Agreement by the Intern or any negligent or  willful acts performed in connection with the internship.



8. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

   8.1 This Agreement shall be governed by, construed, and enforced in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which the Company is incorporated, without regard to its conflicts of law principles.

   8.2 Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be resolved through  amicable negotiations. Should such negotiations fail, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of arbitration applicable in the jurisdiction.



9. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

   9.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior understandings, representations, and agreements, whether oral or written.

   9.2 Any amendment or modification to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties.



10. SEVERABILITY

    10.1 Should any provision of this Agreement be determined to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect and shall be construed in a manner that most nearly reflects the parties’ original intent.



11. MISCELLANEOUS

    11.1 The failure of either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or limitation of that party’s right to subsequently enforce and compel strict compliance with every provision of this Agreement.

    11.2 This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.



IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Internship Agreement as of the date first written above.



For Learnrithm LTD:



_________________________________________

Name: Peter Chukwuemeka Okafor

Title: Chief Executive Officer

Date: February 13th, 2025



Intern:



_________________________________________

Nwobu Lydia Nikechukwu

Date: February 21st , 2025
